name: Taleswyn
description: A dark fantasy tales web app, client-side only for now.
Built with Next.js, TypeScript, SCSS modules. Backend is ready (NestJS), just not used yet.
The theme is deep and old, like lost magic—animated pages, tale carousels, custom fonts, and a calm reading experience.
Built it all solo: frontend, backend, design. Took 3 months of focus and experiments.
It’s the place where I poured my imagination in—no rules, no limits. Learned a lot about server components, Suspense, and Error Boundaries.

name: Lomjati
description: A static website for a healthy food startup run by a student in my university.
Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS.
I handled the frontend based on the design he gave me.
It was the first time I turned someone’s real-world idea into an online product.
Made me realize that people out there really do need devs like us.
